title: Mihawk's Strategic Training Setup
theoryText: The discovery of the giant gravestone and the Humandrills in Episode 456 wasn't coincidental. Some fans theorize that Mihawk deliberately chose Kuraigana Island as his residence because the Humandrills, who learned combat by observing war, would provide perfect training partners for swordsmen. The theory suggests Mihawk may have been planning to train a worthy student even before Zoro arrived, and the island's natural 'training ground' with weapon-wielding creatures was intentional.
author: One Piece Reddit Community
statusExplanation: Later episodes confirm that Mihawk does train Zoro, and the Humandrills become part of his training regimen.

title: Brook's Kidnapping Setup for Soul King Career
theoryText: When Brook decides to stay and repay his debt to Harahettania in Episode 456, fans theorized that his subsequent kidnapping by the Longarm Tribe wasn't just a random event but a setup for his future career. The theory proposed that the Longarm Tribe members who kidnapped him would become his managers, and Brook would become a famous musician during the two-year timeskip, using his skeleton body as a unique performance gimmick.
author: One Piece Theory Community
statusExplanation: This theory was confirmed in later episodes showing Brook as the famous 'Soul King' with the Longarm Tribe members as his managers.

title: The Humandrills as Zoro's Fighting Style Teachers
theoryText: Fans have theorized that the Humandrills' ability to mimic fighting styles they observe would play a crucial role in Zoro's training. Since the Humandrills learned from watching warriors during the Shikkearu Kingdom's war, and later would observe Zoro's techniques, they could serve as training partners who adapt to and counter Zoro's moves, forcing him to constantly evolve his swordsmanship. Some fans even suggested the Humandrills might have observed and mimicked Mihawk's techniques as well.
author: One Piece Analysis Community
statusExplanation: Later episodes show the Humandrills can indeed mimic techniques, including Zoro's moves, though the full extent of their role in his training varies from the theory.

title: Perona's Influence on Zoro's Character Development
theoryText: Some fans theorized that Perona's presence on Kuraigana Island and her interactions with Zoro (like returning his swords in Episode 456) would lead to significant character development for both characters. The theory suggested that Perona would help Zoro develop better interpersonal skills and perhaps even influence his approach to teamwork, while Zoro would help Perona find purpose beyond serving Moria.
author: Character Analysis Fans
statusExplanation: While Perona does stay with Zoro and they develop a friendly relationship, the full extent of character development varies from fan expectations.
